subject: p16826047
History: Asymptomatic desaturation, question worsening pleural effusion.
Impression: AP chest compared to through : The largely fissural right pleural effusion has increased minimally since. Accompanying increase in moderate cardiomegaly and mediastinal vascular caliber suggests a component of early cardiac decompensation may be present. There is no pneumothorax. Right subclavian infusion port ends in the mid SVC. There is no appreciable left pleural effusion. The right pleural drainage catheter has not migrated since a PET/CT on shows it cannulates the right interlobar fissures from which the loculated pleural effusion should be accessible.
